oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Camel Rock & Roll Dance Party - 1956-07-07 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: CBS Rock 'N' Roll Dance Party program sponsored by Camel cigarettes, 1956-07-07 (as dated on disc label, announcement on the 1956-06-30 show suggests this show may have aired 1956-07-10 instead) part 2. Hosted by Alan Freed with announcer Bern Bennett, starring Sam ""The Man"" Taylor and his orchestra, and featuring Clyde McPhatter, the Platters, Della Reese, and Sugar & Spice. Produced and directed by Lou Melamed.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Sugar & Spice; Platters; Sam "The Man" Taylor; Big Al Sears; Haywood Henry
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Alan Freed introduces Sugar & Spice -- Don't Be A Bunny (Sugar & Spice) -- Camel Cigarettes commercial (Alan Freed) -- Alan Freed introduces the Platters -- (You've Got) The Magic Touch (Platters) -- Alan Freed talks about Tony Williams and the Platters -- My Prayer (Platters) -- Camel Cigarettes commercial (Alan Freed) -- Camel Cigarettes jingle -- Alan Freed introduces Sam ""The Man"" Taylor, Big Al Sears, and Haywood Henry -- Wailin' (Sam ""The Man"" Taylor, Big Al Sears, Haywood Henry) -- Closing statement (Alan Freed) -- Closing theme -- Closing statement (Bern Bennett) -- Station announcements
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: CBS Inc.; WCBS (Radio station : New York, N.Y.); R.J. Reynolds Tobacco Company; Camel rock 'n roll dance party (Radio program); Freed, Alan; Bennett, Bern, 1921-2014; Taylor, Sam; Reese, Della; McPhatter, Clyde; Platters (Musical group); Williams, Tony, 1928-1992; Sugar & Spice (Musical group); Melamed, Louis; Sears, Al, 1910-1990; Henry, Haywood
